properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 6 at 8:06AM MST until February 7 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Rapid City SD
properties.description:
...SNOW ACROSS THE BEAR LODGE MOUNTAINS AND THE NORTHERN AND
CENTRAL BLACK HILLS TODAY INTO TONIGHT...

.A clipper system will drop through the Northern Plains today into
tonight, producing an extended period of upslope snow across the
Bear Lodge Mountains and the northern and central Black Hills.
Highest snow amounts will be from the Lead and Deadwood areas, to
O'Neill Pass, and south to the Four Corners area.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 9
inches, with locally higher amounts possible.

* WHERE...The Northern Black Hills.

* WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather
conditions are expected. This will create dangerous conditions.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST FRIDAY
